messages.subject: Re: Jackson Pollock
messages.msgSnippet: ... might be fun to set him up ... outside and let him go ... Oh, what a great idea! My stepson is learning to spray-paint and I was just thinking how nice it
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Julie v." <jlvw@...> wrote:
>> my son was really interested in what he was doing. I thought it
might be fun to set him up
> with some paint and a big sheet of paper or some sort of material
outside and let him go
> for it.

Oh, what a great idea! My stepson is learning to spray-paint and I was
just thinking how nice it would be if he could paint on something
really big - like the side of our barn. Fabric would be a great way to
facilitate that, if he's into it. Thanks for getting my brain buzzing!

---Meredith (Mo 5, dss Ray 13)

messages.subject: Re: Jackson Pollock
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Kelly!  My son will really like this.  I m somewhat of a fan, his style really amazes me.  I was introduced to him in college and in one of my classes
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Kelly! My son will really like this. I'm somewhat of a fan, his style really amazes
me. I was introduced to him in college and in one of my classes we watched a life story
about him. A few weeks ago my son Damek (4.5) & I watched a special on him on PBS and
my son was really interested in what he was doing. I thought it might be fun to set him up
with some paint and a big sheet of paper or some sort of material outside and let him go
for it.

Julie
